identificationModule.briefTitle: Safety and Efficacy of SINOMED SR for Endovascular Treatment of Acute Ischemic Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Prospective, Multicenter, Randomized Controlled, Non-inferiority Study to Investigate the Effectiveness and Safety of Intracranial Embolization Stents for Endovascular Treatment of Acute Ischemic Stroke

descriptionModule.briefSummary: A prospective, multicenter, randomized controlled, non-inferiority study to investigate the effectiveness and safety of SINOMED SR for endovascular treatment of acute ischemic stroke
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: This is a multicenter, prospective, randomized, 1:1, controlled trial with blinded outcome assessment assessing non-inferiority of SINOMED SR compared to Solitaire FR. The trial aims to randomize 220 patients 1:1 to receive SINOMED SR or Solitaire FR.The primary outcome is the Success rate of immediate recanalization.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Prospective, multicenter, randomized controlled, non-infertility study

armGroups.label: Thrombectomy-SINOMED SR
armGroups.description: Patients diagnosed with acute ischemic stroke within 24 hours from the onset of the stroke to the completion of femoral artery puncture, regardless of whether intravenous thrombolysis has been performed. Intracranial thrombectomy stents can be used to remove the thrombus in the large vessels of the brain in patients with ischemic stroke To restore blood flow.

armGroups.label: Thrombectomy-Solitaire FR
armGroups.description: Intracranial thrombectomy was performed with a control product（name:Solitaire FR）

interventions.name: Intracranial thrombectomy stent
interventions.description: Intracranial thrombectomy stents for ischemic stroke patients within 24 hours of symptom onset

primaryOutcomes.description: The criteria for successful immediate recanalization were target recanalization with a mTICI grade of 2b or 3 grade

secondaryOutcomes.description: The ratio of mRS 0-2 points = the number of subjects with mRS 0-2 points 90 days after surgery/the number of subjects receiving thrombectomy by intracranial thrombectomy device ×100%

secondaryOutcomes.measure: The time from femoral artery puncture to vascular recanalization or the end time of surgery for patients with no vascular recanalization
secondaryOutcomes.description: Vascular recanalization time = successful recanalization time - femoral artery puncture time

secondaryOutcomes.measure: The NIHSS score decreased the rate of subjects with > 4 points
secondaryOutcomes.description: The ratio of subjects with NIHSS score decreased \> 4 points = the number of subjects with NIHSS score decreased \> 4 points/the number of subjects with thrombotic stent thrombectomy ×100% in this group
Device operation success = the number of devices completed conveying, releasing and retracting in the group/the number of all test devices used in the group ×100%

secondaryOutcomes.measure: The incidence of symptomatic intracranial hemorrhage within 24 h post-procedure
secondaryOutcomes.description: Symptomatic intracranial hemorrhage within 24 h, specifically intracranial hemorrhage (intracranial parenchymal hematoma, subarachnoid hemorrhage, and ventricular hemorrhage) accompanied by neurological deterioration (NIHSS score increased by ≥4 points compared with preoperative)
All-cause mortality = the number of deaths in this group/the number of subjects receiving intracranial thrombectomy stent for thrombectomy in this group ×100%
Defects of research devices during clinical trials, such as broken devices, incorrect labeling, etc
Incidence of SAE = number of subjects with SAE/number of subjects receiving thrombectomy with intracranial thrombectomy device ×100%
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: intra-operative, 24 hours, 7 days and 90 days post-procedure

secondaryOutcomes.description: Incidence of AE = number of subjects with AE/number of subjects receiving thrombectomy with intracranial thrombectomy device ×100%
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: intra-operative, 24 hours, 7 days and 90 days post-procedure
